availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James W. Cochran (Lexington, Kentucky, insurance agent)

body.p: Lexington, Fayette County, Kentucky, insurance agent. Kentucky native. Married to Theodocia S. Payne Cochran. Father of John Cochran, Nathan P. Cochran, Kate Cochran, and Mary Cochran. Merchant in Fayette County in 1850. Owned six enslaved persons in Fayette County in 1850. Insurance agent in Lexington in 1860. Household owned three enslaved persons in Lexington in 1860. Notary public in Fayette County in 1861.
